snippet: J. Christopher Stevens, the American ambassador who was killed on Tuesday, knew the opportunities and travails facing Libya after the fall of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.
abstract: J Christopher Stevens, American ambassador killed during a prolonged assault on the American consulate in Libya, knew and understood the opportunities and travails facing Libya after the fall of Col Muammar el-Qaddafi; he is the first United States ambassador killed in an attack while on duty since since 1979.

byline.contributor: Harvey Morris contributed reporting from London; Kareem Fahim from Beirut, Lebanon; and Michael Schmidt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: J. Christopher Stevens, the American ambassador who was killed on Tuesday, knew the opportunities and travails facing Libya after the fall of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

headline.seo: For Veteran Envoy Stevens, Return to Libya Was Full of Hope
headline.main: For Veteran Envoy, Return to Libya Was Full of Hope
headline.print_headline: For Veteran Envoy, Return To Libya Was Full of Hope
